document.masterDocTitle: New and little known digger wasps of the genus Ammophila W. Kirby, 1798 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Sphecidae) from Central Asia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New and little known digger wasps of the genus Ammophila W. Kirby, 1798 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Sphecidae) from Central Asia

bibRefCitation.author: Morawitz
bibRefCitation.refString: Morawitz, F. (1891) Ueber Astrachan'sche Fossorien. Horae Societatis Entomologicae Rossicae, 25, 175 - 233.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ammophila separanda
F. Morawitz 1891
: 204
, ♀, ♂. Lectotype , here designated: ♀, Kazakhstan : West Kazakhstan region, Ryn Peski ( ZISP ), examined.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The female and male of
A. separanda
are most similar to
A. vetuberosa
Li & Yang, 1994
and
A. asiatica Tsuneki, 1971
.
Ammophila vetuberosa
differs from
A. separanda
in having the forecoxa with an apical tooth. The female of
A. separanda
differs from
A. asiatica
in having a red petiole (S 1 ) rather than a black one, and the male in having a shiny mesoscutum (mesoscutum is dull and transversely microstriate in
A. asiatica
).

Material examined. Lectotype , here designated: ♀, Kazakhstan : West Kazakhstan region, Ryn Peski ( ZISP ); paralectotypes : 1 ♀,
